trial_identification.studytitle: Phase II Trial of Temozolomide and Caelyx in the Treatment of Patients with Glioblastoma Multiforme following concurrent radiotherapy and chemotherapy
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Phase II Trial of Temozolomide and Caelyx in the Treatment of Patients with Glioblastoma Multiforme following concurrent radiotherapy and chemotherapy to improve six month progression free survival

interventions.interventions: Phase II Trial of six months of oral Temozolomide (200mg/m2 days 1-5, q4 weekly) and intravenous liposomal doxorubicin (40mg/m2 q 4 weekly) (Caelyx) in standard doses in the Treatment of Patients with Glioblastoma Multiforme following concurrent radiotherapy and chemotherapy to improve six month progression free survival.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Six month progression free survival following commencement of therapy.

secondaryOutcome.timepoint: during the course of treatment and for 30 days post completion

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Inclusion: Newly diagnosed glioblastoma, performance status 0-2, completed post-operative concurrent radiotherapy/chemotherapy.

ethicsAndSummary.summary: Standard of care post surgery for GBM is concurrent radiotherapy/chemotherapy followed by 6 months of chemotherapy (temozolomide). We have previously shown that the combination of Temozolomide with liposomal doxorubicin (caelyx) has activity in recrurrent GBM and is well tolerated. This study aims to assess whether the addition of liposomal doxorubicin to six months of post RT temozolomide is efficacious and well tolerated

ethicscommitee.ethicname: Currently under review by Royal Melbourne

contact.name: Professor Mark Rosenthal
contact.address: Department of Medical Oncology Royal Melbourne Hospital Grattan Street VIC 3050
